abstract: It seems that John F. Welch Jr.’s dream of becoming a newspaper baron will have to wait. Speaking before an audience at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, the former chairman of General Electric said Thursday that The New York Times Company has made it clear that the Boston Globe is not for sale. Last year, Mr. Welch expressed an interest in buying The Globe, and he joined with Jack Connors, co-founder of Boston advertising agency Hill Holliday, to explore making an offer. But the Times Company has repeatedly said that The Globe is not on the block, and Mr. Welch appears to have gotten the message.
